thread.title: Season 2 of Ryan Murphy's 'Feud' Will Feature the Royal Family
thread.title_full: Season 2 of Ryan Murphy's 'Feud' Will Feature the Royal Family

title: Season 2 of Ryan Murphy's 'Feud' Will Feature the Royal Family

organizations.name: gif advertisement - continue reading below variety

text: By Sally Holmes Feb 28, 2017 Hold on to your corgis, people, big, JUICY news from the land of scandalous TV: Ryan Murphy's new show Feud , which hasn't even premiered its first season, has already been renewed for season two, and it will tackle the relationship between Prince Charles and Princess Diana. Yes. GIF Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Variety reports that 'Charles and Diana' will be 10 episodes, though no news about the premiere date or casting has been announced. Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer wed in 1981 and had a notoriously tumultuous marriage from the start, with the two ultimately divorcing in 1996. Diana died a year later in a car crash in Paris. Getty Most Popular The first season of Feud is titled 'Bette and Joan' and will feature Bette Davis (Susan Sarandon) and Joan Crawford (Jessica Lange) tormenting one another on the set of 1962's What Ever Happened To Baby Jane? , which we're all very much looking forward to. But CHARLES AND DIANA Getty This raises so many questions: Who will play Diana? Who will play the QUEEN? Will we see a recreation of the most epic of royal weddings (and wedding dresses ) of all time? Who will be responsible for Diana's uber chic wardrobe ? And, of course, WHAT WILL HARRY SAY? More from ELLE:
